Auch wenn Portal bereits vor fast 15 Jahren auf den Markt kam, gilt es noch heute als ein hervorragendes R√§tselspiel - die Preise, die es bei erscheinen abger√§umt hat, sprechen ja eindeutig f√ºr sich.

Worum gehts? Man findet sich als eine Art Versuchskaninchen wieder und muss mit seiner "Waffe" Portale erschaffen. Sind die Level anfangs noch sehr einfach, steigt der Schwierigkeitsgrad nach und nach an, so dass es teilweise geradezu frustrierend sein kann - aber die Genugtuung, das Level dann geschafft zu haben, ist einfach riesig (ich bin gerade mal bei Testlevel 15 und finde das schon teilweise echt haarstr√§ubend). Dennoch ist das Spielprinzip innovativ, der Humor genial, die Sprachumsetzung toll und das ganze Deisgn der Levels liebevoll und geradezu s√º√ü gemacht.

Das alles, besonders im Sale f√ºr knapp 4 Euro ist auf jeden Fall einen Blick wert. <3

5 von 5 Sternen. :-)

Figured I'd go ahead and leave a review for anyone who hasn't played this yet. This game has aged really well. The story keeps you interested in the mystery that is your situation and the puzzle-solving is stimulating without being too hard or overbearing. This game is such a classic and spawned so many memes, mods, and a great sequel that many expected Valve to pass on making. If you love Valve's storytelling you owe it to yourself to play this.
Uses environmental puzzle solving masterfully with one of the gamings most creative and enjoyable game mechanics in the portal gun. Fun story with lots of Half Life easter eggs.

Short review:

Portal is a good puzzle game with a few secrets which is worth the price, discount or no discount. The main antagonist is hilarious and the story is unique. I recommend.

Long review:

I have poured my life and soul into this game to try and get more out of it. It's wonderful. From the beginning of the game to the last moment, you're solving puzzles that actually require you to use your brain and think from different angles how to work yourself out of a situation. Not only that, but the teaching to learn the mechanics through the puzzles is wonderfully executed and beautifully eased into the storyline.
The story itself slowly presents itself through the game and the environment around. You have to really look for the details of the story of Aperture and use that brain to piece them together, like a puzzle. But trust me when I say it's worth scouring every nook and cranny for the hidden bits of story and lore.
The character[s] are very unique with how they are presented and portrayed. [spoiler] The main antagonist, GLaDOS, is first shown as an ominous voice with no body coaching you through the puzzles. When she's finally revealed, it is shown she is a massive and complex piece of work, and she has many funny dialogue lines (my personal favorite being "Weeeeeeeeeeeeeee [bzzt]"). [/spoiler] The turrets are a main side character that don't aid the plot all to much in the first Portal game, but are very significant in the second. I still like to listen to them talk, though, and I try to piece a story together for them in my free time just to make them seem less mechanical and ready-to-kill.
The graphics are amazing for a game released in 2007 and even though it's 2022, it's better than other games that I have. Don't worry about your device overheating; despite the good graphics and portal mechanics, Valve has done an amazing job at keeping things simple enough so I could run this game first on a five year old laptop that struggles to run a painting program. Rest assured your device won't explode.
The music is nice. Nothing too notable about it. It fits the atmosphere and provides great background noise while you venture through the testing chambers. My favorite song, though, has to be Still Alive. [spoiler] It's the final song played in the game once you beat it. I find the sarcastic and snarky comments GLaDOS makes in it to be very funny, [/spoiler] and it even encouraged me to learn it on the piano (which I did!).
I cannot for the life of me promote this game enough to you. It's worth the money ten times over, and has amazing replayability value if you want to go back through it ten, twelve, twenty times even. I know I've played through it a lot.
And if you're checking out this game and considering purchasing Portal 2, DO IT! Portal 2 is an amazing continuation of Portal that doesn't require this game to be played to pick up the newer version (I do recommend playing this first before Portal 2, but it's entirely optional). 
All in all, a fabulous game with a fabulous production team making this game a 9/10.
The only problems are that some of the puzzles are a bit too difficult and the portals can be tricky, but this all goes away with practice or getting help from some of the community guides.

I absolutely love the lonely feeling of this game. The soundtrack - it is amazing! The game hints you that something is off right from the start of the game when robotic voice welcomes you in the facility and tells you safety instructions. Her voice glitches when she starts telling you important stuff about safety. This game really makes you immersive. You must play this game! I doubt you will get bored!

Portal es un juego que se mantiene vivo a pesar de los a√±os, coexiste en el universo de half-life a su vez que cuenta su propia historia.

Sin dudas no pierde la esencia y ning√∫n otro triple A pudo igualar su calidad hasta la fecha.

Si sos nuevo en el PC gaming te recomiendo encarecidamente comprar este juego para que explores lo que se hacia en el 2007 con pocos elementos y una gran idea, uno de los juegos que Valve pudo pulir con tan poco.

La antagonista principal logra ser uno de los mejores villanos de los videojuegos, odiable al mismo punto que memorable y querido por la comunidad.
La protagonista mas que memorable, es iconica.

This game is so short, you'd probably be able to rush the main story in your first go and subsequently refund the game - but you'll miss out on the bonus content which I have yet to play. It started off quite boring but ended up real fun later on; a solid tidesfordrive I'd say.

Oh, and don't finish it and refund. That'd just be lame..
